greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of different numbers that are formed by permuting digits of n.
comment: The minimum value of a(A171102(n)) is 10*9!. - _Altug Alkan_, Jul 08 2016
link: A. Dunigan AtLee, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000.
formula: a(n) << n / (log_10 n)^4.5 by Stirling's approximation. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 29 2011
example: From 33950 with 5 digits, one '0', two '3', one '5' and one '9', we get 5! / (1! * 2! * 1! * 1!) = 60 different numbers and a(33950) = 60.  - _Bernard Schott_, Oct 20 2019
program: a047726 n = length $ nub $ permutations $ show n
(PARI) A047726(n)={local(c=Vec(0,10)); apply(d->c[d+1]++, digits(n)); logint(n*10,10)!/prod(i=1,10,c[i]!)} \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 18 2019
xref: Cf. A055098. Identical to A043537 and A043562 for n<100.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
